['**Similitude** - A comparison between two unlike things that have something in common.', '**Analogy** - A comparison between two things that are alike in some respects but are different in others.', '**Resemblance** - A physical or psychological similarity between two things.', '**Comparison** - The act of comparing two or more things.', '**Equivalence** - The state of being equal or having the same value as something else.', '**Parallelism** - The arrangement of words or phrases in a sentence so that they have the same grammatical structure.', '**Contrast** - The difference between two things that are contrasting.', '**Homology** - The relationship between words that are derived from the same root or stem.', '**Antonymy** - A word that has the opposite meaning of another word.', '**Synonymy** - The relationship between words that have the same or similar meanings.', '**Metaphor** - A figure of speech in which a word or phrase is applied to something that is not literally of the same kind.', '**Simile** - A figure of speech that explicitly compares two things using the words "like" or "as."', '**Allegory** - A story or poem that has a hidden meaning.', '**Symbolism** - The use of an object or action to represent something else.', '**Parallel construction** - The repetition of a grammatical structure in two or more sentences.', '**Antithesis** - The balancing of opposing ideas or values.', '**Litotes** - The use of understatement to create an effect of emphasis.', '**Oxymoron** - A figure of speech that combines opposite or contradictory ideas.', '**Idiom** - A group of words that have a meaning that is different from the sum of their parts.', '**Proverbs** - A short, traditional saying that expresses a piece of advice or wisdom.']
